metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0766 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
PostgreSQL before 9.1.20, 9.2.x before 9.2.15, 9.3.x before 9.3.11, 9.4.x before 9.4.6, and 9.5.x before 9.5.1 does not properly restrict access to unspecified custom configuration settings (GUCS) for PL/Java, which allows attackers to gain privileges via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0766` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.1-1
libecpg6 - 9.5.1-1
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.1-1
libpq5 - 9.5.1-1
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.1-1
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.1-1
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.1-1
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.1-1
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.1-1
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.1-1
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.5.1-1').
